-MiBsknNSQ6aBG1-2lLNG.description: The English language originated from Germanic dialects brought to Britain by Anglo-Saxon migrants in the 5th century. The language has been influenced by many other cultures and languages over the centuries.

-MiBsknNSQ6aBG1-2lLNG2.description: The Spanish language originated in the Iberian Peninsula, which is now Spain, Portugal, and part of France. It evolved from Vulgar Latin, a spoken form of Latin that was brought to the region by the Romans.
